subject: Design
title: Digital Twins: Designing in a Mirror World
description: A quick win: understand Digital Twins: Designing in a Mirror World.

hook.text: Singapore has a complete digital copy of itself â€” every building, road, and pipe. It's a city's digital twin.

buildup.text: A digital twin is a real-time virtual replica of a physical object, updated by sensors and data.

discovery.text: Engineers test design changes on the twin before building them. Failures happen virtually, not physically.

twist.text: Boeing designed the 777X entirely as a digital twin before building a single physical part.

climax.text: Digital twins let designers iterate in a world where mistakes cost nothing. Physical becomes optional.

punchline.text: The future of design is building things twice â€” once in data, once in atoms.
